thread.title: Man City's deals during the January transfer window
thread.title_full: Man City's deals during the January transfer window

author: Charlotte Duncker
title: Man City's deals during the January transfer window
text:
Man City's deals during the January transfer window Manchester City had a quiet Deadline Day but did complete some January transfer window deals. Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Get Manchester City FC   Could   
Pep Guardiola had a relatively quiet first January transfer window in charge of Manchester City. 
The boss made it clear that he was happy with his squad and aside from the arrival of Gabriel Jesus , whose signing was announced in the summer, there were no incomings to the Etihad Stadium this month. 
City announced the signing of Jesus from Brazilian side Palmeiras in the summer but the 19-year-old finished the season off with his former club before arriving in Manchester at the start of the month. 
Aside from Jesus the rest of City's business during the window was outgoings - the majority younger players loaned out to gain first team experience. 
David Faupala joined League One side Chesterfield until the end of April after an unsuccessful loan spell at Dutch side NAC Breda, while left back Angelino has gone to Real Mallorca for the rest of the season. Read More Man City given double boost for trip to West Ham 
The 20-year-old went out on loan to Girona, along with Pablo Maffeo, at the start of the month, but after he didn't make the starting line up he was pulled back to Manchester. 
Bruno Zuculini has gone to Hellas Verona while Manu Garcia has joined NAC Breda, both loan deals until the end of the season. 
The only players to leave the club permanently were George Glendon, whose loan at Fleetwood Town was made permanent, and goalkeeper Ian Lawlor, who was sold to Doncaster. Read More
